thumb.title: MRI for Dynamic Assessment
thumb.description: Recent advances in real-time MRI technology now allow imaging while the subject is in motion, such as during walking or joint movements.In particular, the development of high-impedance glove-type coils for the hand has made it possible to capture hand movements with a temporal resolution of approximately 20 to 30 milliseconds. This enables dynamic evaluation of morphological changes and injuries during joint motion.This technology is attracting attention in clinical research for assessing joint function and investigating the dynamic behavior of pathological conditions.#廣戸孝行
